headline: IBM to acquire Confluent for $11B as it seeks to bolster its data offerings
summary: IBM is buying data infrastructure company Confluent for $11 billion in cash in a bid to to bolster its data and automation products as ever more companies move their tech operations to the cloud and deploy AI technology.

raw.headline: IBM to acquire Confluent for $11B as it seeks to bolster its data offerings

headline: Confluent Stock Soars on  IBM Acquisition. Why IBM Is Making the Deal.
summary: Confluent  stock surged Monday after  International Business Machines  agreed to buy the data-infrastructure company in a deal for $11 billion.  In a press release, IBM said it would acquire all of Confluent’s issued and outstanding common shares for $31 a share, representing an enterprise value of $11 billion.  Confluent stock jumped 29% to $29.78, putting them on pace for their largest same-day percent increase since a 34% jump in February 2024, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

raw.headline: Confluent Stock Soars on  IBM Acquisition. Why IBM Is Making the Deal.

In a press release, IBM said it would acquire all of Confluent’s issued and outstanding common shares for $31 a share, representing an enterprise value of $11 billion.  Confluent stock jumped 29% to $29.78, putting them on pace for their largest same-day percent increase since a 34% jump in February 2024, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: IBM buys data streaming platform Confluent in $11 billion deal
summary: IBM said Monday it's buying data streaming platform Confluent in a deal worth $11 billion that will help bolster the technology company's artificial intelligence strategy.  The two companies said they signed a “definitive agreement” for IBM to acquire all of Confluent Inc.'s issued and outstanding common stock for $31 per share in cash, which represents an enterprise value of $11 billion.  Confluent, based in Mountain View, Calif., is an open source data streaming platform that “connects, processes and governs" data and events in real time, the companies said in a joint statement.

raw.headline: IBM buys data streaming platform Confluent in $11 billion deal
raw.summary: IBM said Monday it's buying data streaming platform Confluent in a deal worth $11 billion that will help bolster the technology company's artificial intelligence strategy.  The two companies said they signed a “definitive agreement” for IBM to acquire all of Confluent Inc.'s issued and outstanding common stock for $31 per share in cash, which represents an enterprise value of $11 billion.  Confluent, based in Mountain View, Calif., is an open source data streaming platform that “connects, processes and governs" data and events in real time, the companies said in a joint statement.

headline: IBM Strikes $11 Billion Deal for Confluent
summary: IBM agreed to pay $31 a share for Confluent.  The Wall Street Journal reported Sunday evening that IBM and Confluent were in advanced deal talks.  Confluent provides technology that helps manage streams of real-time data used in big artificial-intelligence models.
